titles.title: Clean Stove Act of 2008
A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow a credit for qualified expenditures paid or incurred to replace certain wood stoves.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary: 1/30/2008--Introduced. Clean Stove Act of 2008 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow individual taxpayers a tax credit, up to $500, for the cost of replacing a residential wood stove with: (1) a wood-burning stove that complies with current Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) standards; and (2) a pellet or corn-burning stove. Terminates such credit after 2010.
